title: Ticket #6926: Python Bindings: Easy Submit and Cluster Handle
description:
This ticket is a less-aggressive combined version of #6923 and #6924 that adds a subpackage htcondor.basic which implements a simplified version of the Submit object and a Cluster handle object.

basic.Submit is identical to Submit except that it does not take a transaction as an argument to its queue* methods (it builds one internally), and those methods returns a Cluster, which is a handle to the created jobs. The Cluster has convenience methods to Query/Act/Edit on those jobs. Everything is done against the local Schedd (not configurable!).

By implementing this as a subpackage, it will not break any existing users, and the underlying bindings will still be visible to anyone who needs them. New users can be directed at htcondor.basic if their needs can be satisfied by it.

No changes in the underlying C++ code are necessary for the above.

More utility features may follow, built on top of the basic Qeury/Act/Edit trio, maybe as part of other tickets.

We may revisit more aggressive, backwards-compatibility-breaking changes at a later date...

Abandoned in favor of htcondor-jobs: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1msxYFEMgn22TSUGQYd8mpiA1FKQhBXjUsq8kI256x5c/edit?usp=sharing
